reviews.review_msg: Solid choice for CMPT 363. Assignments and tests as well as their markings was fair for the course content.
One of the better professors at SFU. Lectures were a bit boring at times but were usually engaging. Assignments were good and fair. Exams were fair. No major complaints, you can do a lot worse.

Needlessly over-complicated course materials with no bearing on practical interface design, marks get docked randomly for things not on the rubric, and going to lectures is completely useless as they cover nothing that isn't just on the slides. Easy enough in hindsight, but needlessly stressful, arbitrary, useless, and (worst of all) boring.

very boring, can't even complete a sentence without stuttering, really really specific with his grading and takes away marks for tiny mistakes, doesn't have interest in his own content, and did i say very boring? but he's a really nice guy
